intro: Ceropegia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces distinctive flowers with a unique structure, featuring a corona that resembles a crown. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
